wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Janine Stingel, Ph.D., drew from her privileged access to the archives of the Canadian Jewish Congress the fact that the tactic recommended by the ADL in 1947 to destroy the burgeoning Social Credit monetary reform movement in Canada was "smear campaigns". (Social Discredit: Anti-Semitism, Social Credit and the Jewish Response (published in 2000), p. 120)
